newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London Evening Standard - Sept 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London Evening Standard - Sept 30.

text.p: Prepared for Reuters by The Broadcast Monitoring Company

A secret document circulated to Department of Transport and Treasury ministers by the London Underground warns of the possibility of a catastrophe on the underground train network. The report, entitled "If..." details the problems that could result from spending curbs, including collisions caused by decaying signal equipment and crumbling masonry endangering passengers.
WORRIES GROW OVER EMU CURRENCY WAVES

The U.S. administration, Federal Reserve and other world finance ministers have started to consider the possible effects on the dollar and other currencies if European monetary union makes central banks change the make-up of their foreign exchange reserves, according to Chancellor Kenneth Clarke.
CARDCALL PICKS A NATIONAL LOTTERY WINNER
Cardcall, which is only days from its debut on the Alternative Investment Market, has been boosted by the successful launch of its National Lottery phone card.
IMPERIAL AND MILLENNIUM UNRAVEL THE HANSON KNOT

Analysts are predicting that shares in Imperial Tobacco, which will debut on the stock market tomorrow following its demerger from parent Hanson, will trade at a lower than expected price of 380p because of legal action against Imperial and rival company Gallaher which alleges they breached product liability laws. The other Hanson-spin off, Millennium Chemicals, is to be listed only in New York, and is aiming to make itself more resistant to the cyclical nature of demand for its main products, titanium dioxide and polyethylene.
